did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Papers of Professor K. Edward Lay ca. 1967-1993, and 1997-1999
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. 4,300 items (7 Hollinger boxes, 3 linear feet).1 arbitrary_unit

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: See theUniversity of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Professor K. Edward Lay, Accession #12817, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These papers were given to the University of Virginia Library by K. Edward Lay, School of Architecture, Campbell Hall, University of Virginia, and transferred through Jack Robertson, Fiske-Kimball Fine Arts Library, on July 2, 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The papers of K. Edward Lay, Cary D. Langhorne Professor of Architecture, University of Virginia, ca. 1967-1993, and 1997-1999, ca. 4,300 items (7 Hollinger boxes) consist chiefly of slides and negatives of graduate and undergraduate student projects for the architectural design and architectural community involvement courses taught by Professor Lay. Included in the collection, are spiral bound notebooks containing photographs, drawings and news clippings for various student projects.

Also present are typescripts concerning the School of Architecture Administration & History, both compiled by K. Edward Lay, and a copy of a letter from Edwin A. Alderman to W.H. Pearson, August 1, 1908.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in two major groups of papers, the numbered spiral bound notebooks containing material concerning various University of Virginia architecture student projects (Boxes 1-3) and slides of University of Virginia architecture student projects (Boxes 3-7).

did.unittitle: Spiral Bound Notebooks
1) Architectural Community Involvement (ARCI)1971

scopecontent.p: includes: Hope House, the Downtown Mall, Simpson House, Community Action Organization (CAO), Volunteer Community Service Office, Charlottesville Community Service Center,Cavalier DailySpecial Issue, Camp Faith Posters

did.unittitle: 2) Third Year Architectural Design1967-1968

scopecontent.p: includes: projects for Art Center Ecology; Fan Mountain Astronomical Complex; Tension Structures; and the Community Action Organization Hope House

did.unittitle: 3) Third Year Architectural Design1968-1969

scopecontent.p: includes: projects for Camp Faith, Charlottesville-Albemarle County Area; an Observation Tower; and the Richmond/James River area

did.unittitle: 4) Third Year Architectural Design1969-1970

scopecontent.p: includes: projects for Loft Mountain Visitors Center in Shenandoah National Park; Hotel, Restaurant, Shops at Grace Street Block, Richmond; and Medical Offices, Club, & Shops, Richmond

did.unittitle: 5) Third Year Architectural Design1970-1971

scopecontent.p: includes: projects for Housing Site Plan; Belle Isle, Richmond; Research in Environment Systems; Elementary School; and Center for Research and Innovation in Buildings (CRIB) Research

did.unittitle: 6) Architectural Design Graduate Level1971-1972

scopecontent.p: includes: projects for Richmond Waterfront Development High Rise; Georgetown Waterfront; and Third Year Architectural Design projects, including Bakery; Greenhouse; and Communal Living

did.unittitle: 7) Architectural Design Classes in Architectural Community Involvement (ARCI)1971-1972

scopecontent.p: includes: projects for Camp Holiday Trails, Inc.; Renovation of Hope House Exterior; and Experimental Mall Day

did.unittitle: 8) Architectural Design Classes1972-1973

scopecontent.p: includes: projects for the National Park Information Center; University of Virginia Faculty Residence; Crafts Center; Urban Waterfront Design; Peyton Hall; Monticello Visitors Center Competition; Texaco Service Station Competition; Norfolk Waterfront Development Competition; and Studies in Vernacular Architecture

did.unittitle: 9) Architectural Design Classes1973-1975

scopecontent.p: includes: projects for the Bicentennial Visitors Center; Prototype Building System; Transportation Redevelopment; National Design Competition in Corrections Architecture; Corrections Architecture; a Pub; Brown Street Housing; Courts Complex; Marina; Torpedo Plant; Macchu Picchu Competition (A Hotel and Study Facility at an Archaeological Site)

did.unittitle: 10) Measured Drawings Studies in Vernacular Architecture, including news clippings concerning the class1973-1975
Typescripts concerning the School of Architecture Administration & History1997-1999

scopecontent.p: both compiled by K. Edward Lay, and a copy of a letter from Edwin A. Alderman to W.H. Pearson, August 1, 1908

did.unittitle: Studio Project Negatives Notebook - Projects listed in front of notebook1980-1993
Slides of University of Virginia Student Projects
Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 23, 31, & 32)1967-1971

scopecontent.p: includes an ecology project; color project; Richmond hotel, theater, housing and shops; Shenandoah Park Visitor's Center; Belle Isle; an Elementary School, and Hope House (ACRI)

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 32)1972 Spring

scopecontent.p: includes: a Bakery; Communal Living; and a Greenhouse

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects1972 Spring

scopecontent.p: includes: Architecture Community Involvement Health Camp and Georgetown Thesis

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 31 & 101)1972 Fall

scopecontent.p: includes: Information Center; Crafts Center; a House; and Georgetown Townhouses, Old Market, Landscaping, and Restaurant

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 41 & 42)1973

scopecontent.p: includes: Monticello Center; Norfolk Project; Service Station; Charlottesville Transportation Center; Bicentennial Center; and Prototype Restaurant & Bank

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301 & 802)1974

scopecontent.p: includes: Pub; Brown Street Housing; National Competition Citations & Prizes; and Ice Rink

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 402)1975

scopecontent.p: includes: Alexandria Torpedo Plant, Marina, Athletic Club, and Court Offices; and Macchu Picchu Competition

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301,503, & 701)1975-1976

scopecontent.p: includes: Crafts Center; Hotel on Shockoe Slip, Richmond; Theaters; Analysis; and Birdwood Residential College

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 402)1977

scopecontent.p: includes: Fredericksburg Urban Design, City Hall, Waterfront, Athletic Center, Arts & Crafts Center, Inn, and Entertainment Center

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 302)1979

scopecontent.p: includes: Railroad Depot; West Main Street Urban Study; and Y.M.C.A. Fredericksburg

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 302)1980

scopecontent.p: includes: a High School and Mt. Vernon Visitor's Center

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301)1981 Fall

scopecontent.p: includes: A Luxury Hotel and the Richmond Visitor's Center

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 302)1981 Spring

scopecontent.p: includes: A Visual Arts Center and Restaurant

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 302 & 401)1982-1983

scopecontent.p: includes: A Restaurant; and a Washington, D.C. Orientation Center, Hotel, and an Embassy

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 401)1983

scopecontent.p: includes: A Facade Study and Charlottesville Transportation Center; and the AIA Virginia Society Prize Competition

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301 & 402)1984

scopecontent.p: includes: Athletic Center; Architecture Association; Alexandria Waterfront; and Phoenix Charrette

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301 & 401)1985-1986

scopecontent.p: includes: Botanical Garden; Visitor's Center; Library; and Visitor's Center; Columbus, Indiana

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301 & 402)1987

scopecontent.p: includes: University of Virginia Architecture School; Color Facade; Presidential Museum; and Night Club

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 402)1988

scopecontent.p: includes: Embassies in Washington, D.C.

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301, 402)1989

scopecontent.p: includes: A Presidential Library, Princeton University; Library; and Night Club

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301)1990

scopecontent.p: includes: Housing and Three Generation Housing

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 302)1991 Spring

scopecontent.p: includes: Museum V.C. and Fire Station

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301)1991 Fall

scopecontent.p: includes: Housing and A Grand House

did.unittitle: Slides of UVA Architecture Student Projects (Arch. 301)1992 Fall

scopecontent.p: includes: Jackson Park Housing and "S-Ville" House
